verses.verse: Now <WG1161> concerning <WG4012> the things whereof <WG4012> <WG3739> you wrote <WG1125> to me: It is good <WG2570> for a man <WG444> not to touch <WG680> a woman. <WG1135>

Nevertheless, <WG1161> to avoid <WG1223> fornication, <WG4202> let every <WG1538> man have <WG2192> his own <WG1438> wife, <WG1135> and let every <WG1538> woman have <WG2192> her own <WG2398> husband. <WG435>
Let the husband <WG435> render <WG591> to the wife <WG1135> due <WG3784> benevolence: <WG2133> and likewise <WG3668> also <WG2532> the wife <WG1135> to the husband. <WG435>

The wife <WG1135> has not power <WG1850> of her own <WG2398> body, <WG4983> but the husband: <WG435> and likewise <WG3668> also <WG2532> the husband <WG435> has not power <WG1850> of his own <WG2398> body, <WG4983> but the wife. <WG1135>

Defraud <WG650> you not one <WG240> the other, <WG240> except <WG1509> it be with consent <WG4859> for a time, <WG2540> that you may give <WG4980> yourselves to fasting <WG3521> and prayer; <WG4335> and come <WG4905> together <WG1909> again, <WG3825> that Satan <WG4567> tempt <WG3985> you not for your <WG5216> incontinency. <WG192>
But I speak <WG3004> this <WG5124> by permission, <WG4774> and not of commandment. <WG2003>

For I would <WG2309> that all <WG3956> men <WG444> were even <WG2532> as I myself. <WG1683> But every <WG1538> man has <WG2192> his proper <WG2398> gift <WG5486> of God, <WG2316> one <WG3739> <WG3303> after <WG3779> this <WG3779> manner, <WG3779> and another <WG3588> after <WG3779> that.
I say <WG3004> therefore <WG1161> to the unmarried <WG22> and widows, <WG5503> It is good <WG2570> for them if <WG1437> they abide <WG3306> even <WG2504> as I.
But if <WG1487> they cannot <WG3756> contain, <WG1467> let them marry: <WG1060> for it is better <WG2909> to marry <WG1060> than <WG2228> to burn. <WG4448>
And to the married <WG1060> I command, <WG3853> yet not I, but the Lord, <WG2962> Let not the wife <WG1135> depart <WG5562> from her husband: <WG435>

But and if <WG1437> she depart, <WG5562> let her remain <WG3306> unmarried <WG22>or <WG2228> be reconciled <WG2644> to her husband: <WG435> and let not the husband <WG435> put <WG863> away <WG863> his wife. <WG1135>

But to the rest <WG3062> speak <WG3004> I, not the Lord: <WG2962> If <WG1487> any <WG1536> brother <WG80> has <WG2192> a wife <WG1135> that believes <WG571> not, and she be pleased <WG4909> to dwell <WG3611> with him, let him not put <WG863> her away. <WG863>
And the woman <WG1135> which <WG3748> has <WG2192> an husband <WG435> that believes <WG571> not, and if he be pleased <WG4909> to dwell <WG3611> with her, let her not leave <WG863> him.

For the unbelieving <WG571> husband <WG435> is sanctified <WG37> by the wife, <WG1135> and the unbelieving <WG571> wife <WG1135> is sanctified <WG37> by the husband: <WG435> else <WG1893> <WG686> were your <WG5216> children <WG5043> unclean; <WG169> but now <WG3568> are they holy. <WG40>

But if <WG1487> the unbelieving <WG571> depart, <WG5562> let him depart. <WG5562> A brother <WG80> or <WG2228> a sister <WG79> is not under bondage <WG1402> in such <WG5108> cases: but God <WG2316> has called <WG2564> us to peace. <WG1515>

For what <WG5101> know <WG1492> you, O wife, <WG1135> whether <WG1487> you shall save <WG4982> your husband? <WG435> or <WG2228> how <WG5101> know <WG1492> you, O man, <WG435> whether <WG1487> you shall save <WG4982> your wife? <WG1135>

But as God <WG2316> has distributed <WG3307> to every <WG1538> man, as the Lord <WG2962> has called <WG2564> every <WG1538> one, so <WG3779> let him walk. <WG4043> And so <WG3779> ordain <WG1299> I in all <WG3956> churches. <WG1577>

Is any <WG5100> man called <WG2564> being circumcised? <WG4059> let him not become <WG1986> uncircumcised. <WG1986> Is any <WG5100> called <WG2564> in uncircumcision? <WG203> let him not be circumcised. <WG4059>
Circumcision <WG4061> is nothing, <WG3762> and uncircumcision <WG203> is nothing, <WG3762> but the keeping <WG5084> of the commandments <WG1785> of God. <WG2316>
Let every <WG1538> man abide <WG3306> in the same <WG5026> calling <WG2821> wherein <WG1722> <WG3757> he was called. <WG2564>
Are you called <WG2564> being a servant? <WG1401> care <WG3199> not for it: but if <WG1499> you may <WG1410> be made <WG1096> free, <WG1658> use <WG5530> it rather. <WG3123>

For he that is called <WG2564> in the Lord, <WG2962> being a servant, <WG1401> is the Lord's <WG2962> freeman: <WG558> likewise <WG3668> also <WG2532> he that is called, <WG2564> being free, <WG1658> is Christ's <WG5547> servant. <WG1401>
You are bought <WG59> with a price; <WG5092> be not you the servants <WG1401> of men. <WG444>
Brothers, <WG80> let every <WG1538> man, wherein <WG1722> <WG3757> he is called, <WG2564> therein <WG1722> <WG5129> abide <WG3306> with God. <WG2316>

Now <WG1161> concerning <WG4012> virgins <WG3933> I have <WG2192> no <WG3756> commandment <WG2003> of the Lord: <WG2962> yet <WG1161> I give <WG1325> my judgment, <WG1106> as one that has obtained <WG1653> mercy <WG1653> of the Lord <WG2962> to be faithful. <WG4103>
I suppose <WG3543> therefore <WG3767> that this <WG5124> is good <WG2570> for the present <WG1764> distress, <WG318> I say, that it is good <WG2570> for a man <WG444> so <WG3779> to be.
Are you bound <WG1210> to a wife? <WG1135> seek <WG2212> not to be loosed. <WG3089> Are you loosed <WG3080> from a wife? <WG1135> seek <WG2212> not a wife. <WG1135>

But and if <WG1437> you marry, <WG1060> you have not sinned; <WG264> and if <WG1437> a virgin <WG3933> marry, <WG1060> she has not sinned. <WG264> Nevertheless <WG1161> such <WG5108> shall have <WG2192> trouble <WG2347> in the flesh: <WG4561> but I spare <WG5339> you.

But this <WG5124> I say, <WG5346> brothers, <WG80> the time <WG2540> is short: <WG4958> it remains, <WG2076> <WG3063> that both <WG2532> they that have <WG2192> wives <WG1135> be as though they had <WG2192> none; <WG3361>
And they that weep, <WG2799> as though they wept <WG2799> not; and they that rejoice, <WG5463> as though they rejoiced <WG5463> not; and they that buy, <WG59> as though they possessed <WG2722> not;
And they that use <WG5530> this <WG5127> world, <WG2889> as not abusing <WG2710> it: for the fashion <WG4976> of this <WG5129> world <WG2889> passes <WG3855> away.

But I would <WG2309> have you without <WG275> carefulness. <WG275> He that is unmarried <WG22> cares <WG3309> for the things that belong to the Lord, <WG2962> how <WG4459> he may please <WG700> the Lord: <WG2962>
But he that is married <WG1060> cares <WG3309> for the things that are of the world, <WG2889> how <WG4459> he may please <WG700> his wife. <WG1135>

There is difference <WG3307> also <WG2532> between <WG3307> a wife <WG1135> and a virgin. <WG3933> The unmarried <WG22> woman <WG1135> cares <WG3309> for the things of the Lord, <WG2962> that she may be holy <WG40> both <WG2532> in body <WG4983> and in spirit: <WG4151> but she that is married <WG1060> cares <WG3309> for the things of the world, <WG2889> how <WG4459> she may please <WG700> her husband. <WG435>

And this <WG5124> I speak <WG3004> for your <WG5216> own <WG846> profit; <WG4851> not that I may cast <WG1911> a snare <WG1029> on you, but for that which is comely, <WG2158> and that you may attend <WG2145> on the Lord <WG2962> without <WG563> distraction. <WG563>

But if <WG1487> any <WG5100> man think <WG3543> that he behaves <WG807> himself uncomely <WG807> toward <WG1909> his virgin, <WG3933> if <WG1437> she pass <WG5230> the flower <WG5230> of her age, <WG5230> and need <WG3784> so <WG3779> require, <WG1096> let him do <WG4160> what <WG3739> he will, <WG2309> he sins <WG264> not: let them marry. <WG1060>

Nevertheless <WG1161> he that stands <WG2476> steadfast <WG1476> in his heart, <WG2588> having <WG2192> no <WG3361> necessity, <WG318> but has <WG2192> power <WG1849> over <WG4012> his own <WG2398> will, <WG2307> and has so <WG5124> decreed <WG2919> in his heart <WG2588> that he will keep <WG5083> his virgin, <WG3933> does <WG4160> well. <WG2573>
So <WG5620> then <WG2532> he that gives her in marriage <WG1547> does <WG4160> well; <WG2573> but he that gives her not in marriage <WG1547> does <WG4160> better. <WG2573>

The wife <WG1135> is bound <WG1210> by the law <WG3551> as long <WG5550> as her husband <WG435> lives; <WG2198> but if <WG1437> her husband <WG435> be dead, <WG2837> she is at <WG1657> liberty <WG1658> to be married <WG1060> to whom <WG3739> she will; <WG2309> only <WG3440> in the Lord. <WG2962>

But she is happier <WG3107> if <WG1437> she so <WG3779> abide, <WG3306> after <WG2596> my judgment: <WG1106> and I think <WG1380> also <WG2504> that I have <WG2192> the Spirit <WG4151> of God. <WG2316>
